newsitem.title: UK: Japanese stocks in London firm as banks leads way.
newsitem.headline: Japanese stocks in London firm as banks leads way.

text.p: Japanese shares in London firmed on Thursday as the banks took the cue from Tokyo's lead, dealers said.
The Nikkei/ISE 50 index rose 7.0 points or 0.43 percent to 1,647.21 points.

Earlier the 225-share Nikkei average shed its early gains and closed down 54.51 points or 0.26 percent at 20,624.76. The index hit a new 1997 intra-day high of 20,910.79 but fell back as investors locked in their profits.
"The bank has been very buoyant but we saw some profit-taking in the afternoon." one trader said.
Among the banks Sumitomo Bank Corp gained 22.5 yen to 1,885 yen, but retreating from its Tokyo close of 1,890 yen. Fuji Bank firmed 62.50 yen to 1,795 yen. Before it touched a high of 1,800 yen.
Elsewhere Sony were up 85 yen to 9,995 yen, adding another 75 yen from its Tokyo close.
